name: A. Hot Bath
statement:
Bob is about to take a hot bath. There are two taps to fill the bath: a
hot water tap and a cold water tap. The cold water’s temperature is ,
and the hot water’s temperature is . The cold water tap can transmit any
integer number of water units per second from to , inclusive. Similarly,
the hot water tap can transmit from to water units per second.If water
units per second flow through the first tap and water units per second
flow through the second tap, then the resulting bath water temperature
will be:Bob wants to open both taps so that the bath water temperature
was not less than . However, the temperature should be as close as
possible to this value. If there are several optimal variants, Bob
chooses the one that lets fill the bath in the quickest way
possible.Determine how much each tap should be opened so that Bob was
pleased with the result in the end.
